title: Mode-k flattening
summary: In multilinear algebra, mode-m flattening[1][2][3], also known as matrixizing, matricizing, or unfolding,[4] is an operation that reshapes a multi-way array A {\displaystyle {\mathcal {A}}} into a matrix denoted by A [ m ] {\displaystyle A_{[m]}} (a two-way array).
